fi.tira.pentominotiler.logic

Class Search

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.tira.pentominotiler.logic.Search

  • public class Search
extends Object
    A Search object represents a single tiling problem. To run the search, call the method runSearch(). Getters are provided for retrieving the solutions and the duration of the search in milliseconds. The Integer Property "found" (retrievable by foundProperty()) keeps a running count of the number of solutions found â€“ this is convenient for displaying the progress of the search in a GUI.
    Author:
    juha

    • Property Detail

      • found

        public javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty foundProperty
        Get the Property containing the number of solutions found so far.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Search

        public Search(Board initialBoard)
        Construct a Search object. The shape of the Board object defines the search problem. The board must be empty (i.e. no pieces may be placed on it).
        Parameters:
        initialBoard - an empty Board

    • Method Detail

      • runSearch

        public void runSearch()
        Find all solutions to the tiling problem. Preplaces the "X" pentomino in each of its legal positions in or near the quadrant nearest the origin (some positions may be outside the quadrant if the number of rows or columns is odd) and calls search separately on each placement. In the search proper, pieces are placed on squares of increasing Euclidean distance from the origin.

      • getSolutions

        public MyArrayList<Board> getSolutions()
        Return the solutions to the problem. If the search has not yet been run, an empty list is returned.
        Returns:
        solutions

      • foundProperty

        public javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty foundProperty()
        Get the Property containing the number of solutions found so far.

      • getDuration

        public long getDuration()
        Get the duration of the search. The search must be run before using this method.
        Returns:
        the search duration

      • setHeuristicToManhattan

        public void setHeuristicToManhattan()
        Set the search heuristic to Manhattan distance from the origin. This feature is only provided for performance testing purposes. The recommended (and default) heuristic is Euclidean distance from the origin.
